intro: Chamaebatiaria, commonly known as the sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are gray-green, hairy, and aromatic, contributing to its medicinal use in traditional herbal remedies. Chamaebatiaria is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
